basics.name: Nick Scherman
basics.label: Application Developer
basics.summary: Enterprise web developer. Requirements gathering, architecture, design, development and deployment of web applications.

work.summary: Development lead for an integrated banking dashboard. Working in one of the bank's first agile teams.  Developing front end components (using Angular), back end microservices (Nodejs), CMS and maintaining and updating legacy portals. App featured interfacing with third party applications.

UI and microservices developer at a creative media company. Worked on team projects on scrum teams as well as on a solo dev project. Working with product owners, designers and stakeholders on unique applications and websites involving incredible creativity.
highlights: projects include Mustang Customizer (www.mustangcustomizer.com) and Vikings (vikings.history.co.uk)

work.summary: Developed features of a legacy J2ee servlet application. Tested and created migration instructions for the entire application from Websphere 6.1 to 8.5
highlights: Honourable Mention for the Summer 2015 student achievement award.

work.summary: Course marker for foundational web services course (DPS907). Marked student assignments and gave feedback on future course material
MIG welder at a custom fabrication shop. Created hydraulic machinery.

education.summary: The Seneca College school of ICT has an established programming department that teaches fundamental and advanced programming techniques including data structures and algorithms, database design, multithreading and web application development. The program offers co op and has a low graduation rate from an uncompromising curriculum.

The University of Waterloo Arts program provides a strong foundation for research and critical thinking skills as well as business communication skills that are applicable on a daily basis in my work environment
